metadata.title: Construction of Tobacco Mosaic Virus Subgenomic Replicons That Are Replicated and Spread Systemically in Tobacco Plants

abstract.original_text: Two tobacco mosaic virus (TMV)-derived replicons, created by deletion of most of the 126/18$ .40e open reading frame (ORF), replicated and systemically invaded tobacco plants when sorted by wild type TMV. One RNArepecon contained an internal direct repast of 476 nucleotides from the 3' end of the 30-kOa ORF . ARhaugh this ORA was replicated, most of the progeny were heterogeneous in size and smaller than the origin transcript . A aeoand WVderived RPM replicon, without any Internally repeated sequences and containing a deletion of the !y portion of the 30-kDa ORF as well as most of the 1281183-kDa ORF, was created and coinoculated with wild type TMV as helper.
